name: tiddlywiki
description: TiddlyWiki is a unique self-contained wiki and personal knowledge base that runs in the browser as a single HTML file. It supports plugins, scripting, and nonlinear note-taking, and can be self-hosted or stored locally.
features: Single-file wiki: Store your entire wiki in a single HTML file that runs in any web browser.
Nonlinear notes: Create interconnected notes with bidirectional links for knowledge graph-style organization.
Plugin system: Extend functionality with hundreds of community plugins for themes, features, and integrations.
Transclusion: Embed content from one note into another for reusable components and dynamic content.
Tagging: Organize notes with tags and view tag hierarchies for flexible categorization.
Search: Find content across all notes using full-text search with filters and advanced queries.
Macros and scripting: Automate tasks and create custom functionality using built-in macro language.
Portable: Run from local file system, USB drive, or self-hosted server with no installation required.
Version control: Track changes with built-in history or use Git for version control of the HTML file.
Customizable: Modify appearance and behavior extensively through CSS, JavaScript, and configuration.
Export options: Export individual notes or entire wiki in various formats including HTML, Markdown, or JSON.
Offline-first: Work completely offline with optional server sync for multi-device access.
